column4: In Ubuntu 6.10 can I change permissions on file systems using either natulus or pysdm?  All permission boxes are grayed out in natulus and I can't figure out how to launch with gksudo.
I want to open windows files for read/write...  most are fat system so I can share in Linux, I just need to get permissions set up correctly.
a root nautilus is launched with "gksudo nautilus"
